item.title: Primary keys using UUID v7 are (potentially) an HR violation
item.description: I'm building an applicant tracking system where I use UUID v7 for primary keys on the users table. Then I discovered an unintended consequence: UUID v7 embeds a timestamp, which creates a privacy leak. If a user's account was created in 2025 with an ID of 0199b901-fb2b-7745-9e62-019fe1c0ddca, anyone can extract that timestamp and infer a minimum age for the user. The older the account, the older we know the applicant must be, enabling unintentional age discrimination through what should be an opaque identifier.

Check out my courses on Dometrain: https://dometrain.com/courses/?ref=nick-chapsas&promo=youtube Subscribe to my weekly newsletter: https://nickchapsas.com
